info.name: QA collection 2
info.description: A beginner-friendly collection showcasing key Postman features using the JSONPlaceholder API. Learn how to make different types of HTTP requests, organize them into folders, and write basic tests.

item.name: Read Operations

request.description: Fetches all posts from the API. This is a simple GET request that retrieves a list of all available posts. GET requests are used to read data without modifying anything on the server.

item.name: Write Operations

request.description: Creates a new post by sending JSON data in the request body. POST requests are used to create new resources on the server. Notice the Content-Type header and the JSON body with title, body, and userId fields.
Updates an existing post (post #1) by sending the complete updated data. PUT requests replace the entire resource with the new data you provide. Notice we include the ID in both the URL and the body.
Deletes a specific post (post #1). DELETE requests remove resources from the server. This is a destructive operation, though in this demo API, nothing is actually deleted permanently.

item.description: This folder contains requests that modify data on the server - creating, updating, and deleting resources. These operations change the state of the API.
